page.title: 07RANBY VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Ranby has had its own school since 1836. (That of Babworth dates back to 1794). It was built by John Rogers Esq., of Ranby House. Subsequently the property passed to the Dukes of Newcastle, the managers paying Â£8.50 a year in rent. In the early days the schoolmistress received Â£35 p.a. with house and coals. The managers accepted controlled status in 1951, and a new school was erected in 1964 at a cost of Â£15000. Today there are 30 pupils, aged 5 to 11. Of these only 5 come from the village, the rest travelling from the farms. They are taught by a headmaster, one full-time and one part-time teacher.
